fields.name: Arovleti
fields.personality: A brilliant writer who loves the language.
fields.history: An outspoken advocate for republics, he is famous for his wit and his attacks on the Monarchy. His identity is not known and the only way to communicate with him is through correspondence of various kinds. They must use methods such as plays, poems, novels and newspaper articles. He is a hero of the masses. He is the gentlemen bard. From a narrative standpoint, he often provides fresh new ways of looking at the past. His messages often have a propaganda spin, but appeal to Enlightenment values. He is significant to the greater political events because: he causes an undercurrent of fear among the nobility for the -unwashed masses-, his writings is used as written evidence to condemn a noble in a conspiratorial plot, and he triggers the paranoia of a key character leading to another significant event.
fields.secret: His true identity. Discovering that is potential goal a reader might have of the story. There will be imposters.

fields.name: Bjorn
fields.personality: A highly pragmatic man who is a wise and effective warrior.
fields.secret: That he is an assassin. He makes out that he is a Fighter. However a number of clues point to the fact that not everything is as it seems - especially with regards to his knowledge and class abilities.

fields.name: Thereus
fields.personality: Proud, aggressive, lawless, and usually drunk. He is one with nature and very obstinate. He comes across as a father figure to those -cubs- that he nurtures. He instills in them that the world is harsh and that they must be fit to survive. Among females, he is very randy and protective.
